alert.note: Alert for Chester; Delaware (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 27 at 6:54AM EDT until June 27 at 9:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Brandywine Creek At Chadds Ford affecting Delaware and Chester Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Brandywine Creek At Chadds Ford. * WHEN...Until late this morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Open adjacent land next to the creek floods. At 10.0 feet, The intersections of Creek Road and Route 926 near Pocopson floods upstream of Chadds Ford. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 9.2 feet late this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.2 feet on 04/02/1998. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (8 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Stg Time Date Brandywine Creek Chadds Ford 9.0 8.0 Tue 6 am 6.0 3.1 9.2 9am 6/27 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this morning by 900 AM EDT.
